topic.title: The UF Department of Geography is recruiting motivated students to participate in the summer 2025 GeoGator Summer Undergraduate Research Experience!
topic.text:
Applications will close at the end of this week (2/23)

The UF GeoGator Summer Undergraduate Research Experience is a research opportunity for undergraduate students to participate in an active research project with a faculty member in the Geography department. The program provides students with the opportunity to gain hands-on experience, the chance to be involved with cutting edge research and lab environments, the opportunity to identify and develop career-related skills and abilities, and also provide a chance to network with professionals. This program aims to prepare students for future careers by gaining valuable and marketable experience, and expanding their knowledge beyond the classroom. This for-credit research experience will launch during 2025â€™s Summer C term.

Visit the GeoGator Summer Undergraduate Research Experience  website to explore potential summer research projects, find more information about the summer schedule, and to apply!

Questions about the GeoGator Summer Undergraduate Research Experience should be directed to the program coordinator, Dr. Gabriela Hamerlinck (ghamerlinck@ufl.edu).
